The plant is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. Bivolva species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to both livestock and humans if ingested.
